name: Arches
fact: Arches National Park has over 2,000 natural stone arches.

name: Denali
fact: Denali's peak is 20,310 feet above sea level, making it the highest mountain in North America.

name: Everglades
fact: The Everglades are home to thirteen endangered and ten threatened species.

name: Glacier
fact: There are 762 lakes in Glacier National Park.

name: Grand Canyon
fact: The Grand Canyon was carved over some 6 million years.

name: Ise Royal
fact: Isle Royal is the least visited park in the United States.

name: Olympic
fact: Olympic protects a region of the North Americaâ€™s remaining temperate rain forests.

name: rockymountain
fact: 30% of Rocky Mountain National Park is above the tree line.

name: Smoky Mountains
fact: Great Smoky Mountains National Park runs through Tennessee and North Carolina.

name: Yellowstone
fact: Yellowstone was the first designated National Park.

name: Yosemite
fact: The Ahwaneechee Native Americans lived in the Yosemite Valley for at least 4,000 years.

name: Zion
fact: 289 species of birds live in Zion National Park.
